p: The link between water and hygienic practices should be considered when developing drought adaptation measures. Conservation should take into consideration on-farm agricultural practices, regional water management and treatment and allow for and encourage individual hygienic practices such as hand washing [ 46]. In the later example, homes and businesses could also promote both water conservation and hand washing by installing low-flow faucet aerators [ 46]. Education of health care providers can also benefit efforts to address drought impacts on health [ 53].
